name: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Appellant, v. Daniel STREEPER, Appellee

judges: Before CAPPY, C.J., and CASTILLE, NIGRO, NEWMAN, SAYLOR, EAKIN and BAER, JJ.
parties: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Appellant, v. Daniel STREEPER, Appellee.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM:
AND NOW, this 23rd day of March, 2004, the order of the Bucks County Court of Common Pleas is reversed insofar as it declared the Registration of Sexual Offenders Act unconstitutional, and the case is remanded for further proceedings. See Commonwealth v. Williams, 574 Pa. 487, 832 A.2d 962 (2003); Commonwealth v. Maldonado, 576 Pa. 101, 838 A.2d 710 (2003).
opinions.author: PER CURIAM:

attorneys: Thomas Gary Gambardella, Doylestown, for Commonwealth of Pennsylvania.
Ellis B. Klein, Doylestown, for Daniel Streeper.
casebody.head_matter:
845 A.2d 767
COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Appellant, v. Daniel STREEPER, Appellee.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Submitted Oct. 7, 2003.
Decided March 23, 2004.
Thomas Gary Gambardella, Doylestown, for Commonwealth of Pennsylvania.
Ellis B. Klein, Doylestown, for Daniel Streeper.
Before CAPPY, C.J., and CASTILLE, NIGRO, NEWMAN, SAYLOR, EAKIN and BAER, JJ.
